element.name: Where Eagles Dare by Hezekiah and Kili or Bust, Traditional Cache (2/3.5)

center.font: Visit the new Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

long-description.p: A short hike – 45 mins each way from the car park (at 53 10.491N : 006 17.504W) – to a spectacular location.
Bear in mind, you will need proper gear for the terrain and weather– also be aware that car parks in the Wicklow area are not at their safest at the weekends.

element.encoded-hints: Hidden under a large rock, near the base of the crag - see spoiler

ul.li:
2009-10-11T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by crc_73
My first try for a cache, and it was a bust, couldn't find it. Went down quite a bit from the bottom of the crag, and searched around all the boulders, but nothing. GPS co-ordinates pointed to a position going up around the left-hand side of the crag, but nothing there either. Even took the picture of Stephen_McC with his dog as a reference, think I found the rock he was beside, but no cache around there.
Wet and muddy starting out, and misty too, couldn't see the water in the lower lake, but as soon as I got to the top of the crag it opened up, and the view was spectacular. Followed the ridge around the upper lake back to the parking spot. A nice 2 hour hike, including searching, about 4kms in total. Worth the scramble up to the crag.
Would go back again, but will wait for someone to confirm the cache is still there.

2009-09-13T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by woodenbuttons
searched around but could not find it. saw a perfect spot that seemed would be perfect for a geocache with a covering liftable stone, but nothing. maybe its gone? will be interesting to see if someone else finds it next!

2009-06-29T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by nisse_perlemo
Spectacular location, worth a visit any time. Couldn't find the cache, although I searched for a long time. Other problems: Some 20 + goats looked menacingly down at me during the final ascent and I contemplated retreat, but they moved away as I got closer.

2009-03-23T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by marra-cache
Absolutely great place for a cache. Unfortunately I couldn't find it in the end after searching pretty long [:(] Sometimes I couldn't find the correct path up, especially the last 150m which made it T 4,5 for me. Got pretty wet & dirty shoes but it was worth it! TFTC, marra-cache from Schwetzingen (Germany)

2007-08-18T19:00:00Z : Found it by biker-T
Really a nice cache!

wpt.name: GCP1PC
wpt.desc: Where Eagles Dare by Hezekiah and Kili or Bust, Traditional Cache (2/3.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Where Eagles Dare
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: Visit the new Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
A short hike – 45 mins each way from the car park (at 53 10.491N : 006 17.504W) – to a spectacular location.

Bear in mind, you will need proper gear for the terrain and weather– also be aware that car parks in the Wicklow area are not at their safest at the weekends.
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:encoded_hints: Hidden under a large rock, near the base of the crag - see spoiler

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text:
My first try for a cache, and it was a bust, couldn't find it. Went down quite a bit from the bottom of the crag, and searched around all the boulders, but nothing. GPS co-ordinates pointed to a position going up around the left-hand side of the crag, but nothing there either. Even took the picture of Stephen_McC with his dog as a reference, think I found the rock he was beside, but no cache around there.
Wet and muddy starting out, and misty too, couldn't see the water in the lower lake, but as soon as I got to the top of the crag it opened up, and the view was spectacular. Followed the ridge around the upper lake back to the parking spot. A nice 2 hour hike, including searching, about 4kms in total. Worth the scramble up to the crag.
Would go back again, but will wait for someone to confirm the cache is still there.

searched around but could not find it. saw a perfect spot that seemed would be perfect for a geocache with a covering liftable stone, but nothing. maybe its gone? will be interesting to see if someone else finds it next!

Spectacular location, worth a visit any time. Couldn't find the cache, although I searched for a long time. Other problems: Some 20 + goats looked menacingly down at me during the final ascent and I contemplated retreat, but they moved away as I got closer.

Absolutely great place for a cache. Unfortunately I couldn't find it in the end after searching pretty long [:(] Sometimes I couldn't find the correct path up, especially the last 150m which made it T 4,5 for me. Got pretty wet & dirty shoes but it was worth it! TFTC, marra-cache from Schwetzingen (Germany)
